entry.title: Combined summary - Proposed BIP for OP_CAT
entry.summary:
A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) has been published suggesting the reintroduction of the OP_CAT opcode in Tapscript. The proposal aims to address the limitation of Tapscript lacking a general-purpose method for combining objects on the stack. By enabling OP_CAT, the functionality and expressive power of tapscript can be expanded, including the ability to construct and evaluate merkle trees and other hashed data structures. This opcode would allow for the concatenation of two values on the stack, pushing the concatenated result back onto the stack.
The motivation behind introducing OP_CAT is to enable various use cases such as tree signatures, which allow for multisignature scripts with a logarithmic size in the number of public keys, and the encoding of generalized logical spend conditions. Other potential use cases include non-equivocation contracts that penalize double spending in Bitcoin payment channels, as well as the implementation of vaults that prevent theft in compromised outputs.
Previously, concerns about potential memory usage exponential in size led to the removal of the OP_CAT opcode. However, with the recent enforcement of a maximum stack element size of 520 Bytes in Tapscript, this concern is no longer relevant. The proposed implementation of OP_CAT involves checking the stack size, concatenating the values, and pushing the resulting value onto the stack.
For more detailed information and references related to OP_CAT and its proposed implementation, please refer to the provided links:
- Draft BIP: [https://github.com/EthanHeilman/op_cat_draft/blob/main/cat.mediawiki](https://github.com/EthanHeilman/op_cat_draft/blob/main/cat.mediawiki) - Unix Environment paper: [https://harmful.cat-v.org/cat-v/unix_prog_design.pdf](https://harmful.cat-v.org/cat-v/unix_prog_design.pdf) - CheckSigFromStack for Arithmetic Values: [https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-July/019233.html](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-July/019233.html) - Penalizing Equivocation by Loss of Bitcoins: [https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.727.6262&rep=rep1&type=pdf](https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.727.6262&rep=rep1&type=pdf) - Merkle Trees and Generalized Consensus: [http://fc16.ifca.ai/bitcoin/papers/MES16.pdf](http://fc16.ifca.ai/bitcoin/papers/MES16.pdf) - CAT and Schnorr Tricks II: [https://www.wpsoftware.net/andrew/blog/cat-and-schnorr-tricks-ii.html](https://www.wpsoftware.net/andrew/blog/cat-and-schnorr-tricks-ii.html) - CAT and Schnorr Tricks I: [https://medium.com/blockstream/cat-and-schnorr-tricks-i-faf1b59bd298](https://medium.com/blockstream/cat-and-schnorr-tricks-i-faf1b59bd298) - Covenants with ECDSA: [https://gist.github.com/RobinLinus/9a69f5552be94d13170ec79bf34d5e85file-covenants_cat_ecdsa-md](https://gist.github.com/RobinLinus/9a69f5552be94d13170ec79bf34d5e85file-covenants_cat_ecdsa-md)
